PHUL Method

4 Day Split

Powerbuilding Focus

The PHUL Method is one of the most popular power-building programs out there. It stands for Power Hypertrophy Upper Lower and it combines strength, size, and endurance training in a single program that gives you lots of flexibility without sacrificing results.

It's often seen as an effective way to maximize your performance and take your physique to the next level. If you're looking for an intense workout routine, then the 4-Day Split PHUL Method might be just what you need!

In this article, we'll look at the benefits of this method, as well as how to get the most out of it if you decide to give it a try. We'll also provide some example workouts for each day so that you can get started right away!

Overview

The PHUL Method is a 4-day split workout plan that focuses on building both strength and size. This well-thought-out program follows some basic principles including frequency, compounds, power, and hypertrophy.

Frequency

Studies have found muscle protein synthesis (MPS) to be up to 48 hours after training with it being optimal for you to hit each muscle more frequently than a weekly split schedule. The PHUL program has two workout days for each muscle group within the same week allowing for maximum results.

Compounds

Pushing the body’s limits with compound exercises is key in this program to progress quickly as well as gain pounds of muscle. Don’t worry though: isolation movements are included to help build those smaller muscles!

Power

Utilizing the right amount of progressive overload with time under tension will increase your ability to move more weight on any exercise. Two days of focusing strictly on pure strength training can do wonders when coupled with the other 2 days of hypertrophy-style training.

Hypertrophy

The other 2 working days focus solely on bodybuilding style lifting specialized in hypertrophy or building size/muscle mass proves this plan’s worth by showing results quickly

How To Implement

The PHUL method requires four workouts each week consisting of two upper-body and two lower-body sessions. Each session is focused on either strength (power) or muscle growth (hypertrophy).

My Variation:

The difference between these two styles of training is the weight and reps used: during the power workouts, you'll use heavier weights with fewer reps, whereas in the hypertrophy workouts, it's moderately heavy weights with a medium number of reps.

This back-and-forth approach allows you to develop different qualities simultaneously and simultaneously build your strength and muscle mass while taking into account proper periodization.

Pros

• Gain strength and hypertrophy at the same time. It divides all muscles into upper and lower muscle groups, focusing on doing one exercise per muscle group to build power or size.

• This split provides lifters with a comprehensive understanding of both power and hypertrophy training, which they can then use to optimize their program and achieve their goals. It also encourages critical thinking about their training.

• Trains muscles twice a week which have been proven to accelerate muscle growth. This makes it an attractive choice for those with busy schedules and who still want to see results from their training program.

Cons

The 4-Day Split - PHUL method has some drawbacks that may be of concern to those considering this type of workout.

• Difficult to tailor your training routine to focus on muscle building or strength, as it is structured with two power workouts and two hypertrophy workouts with little room for alteration.

• As you are only training four times a week, this could leave lifters feeling like they want more if they're used to frequent training. Also, since each muscle group is trained twice a week, it could lead to slower progress than programs that offer more frequency.

Conclusion

In summary, the PHUL method is a great way to achieve a well-rounded workout routine. Not only can it help you gain strength, but also allow you to build muscle and increase your overall fitness level in just four days per week. With consistent dedication and proper execution of exercises, the PHUL method can be a great way to accelerate your progress toward any fitness goals, no matter what they may be.
